world

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • world.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    The World object is the main class that represents the world of the problem. It holds all the places and several functions for producing the world.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      World(int width, int height, java.util.Random rand)
      The World object holds the world array which represents the 2D position of the places, the list of towns in the world and the list of places.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Place> getPlaces() 
      Place setRandomAgent(Agent agent)
      Sets a random Place as the agent's starting location.
      void setRandomClients()
      This is to run periodically in the run of the world.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(int width,
             int height,
             java.util.Random rand)
        The World object holds the world array which represents the 2D position of the places, the list of towns in the world and the list of places.
        Parameters:
        width - World's width
        height - World's height
        rand - The random object

    • Method Detail

      • getPlaces

        public java.util.List<Place> getPlaces()
        Returns:
        the places list

      • setRandomAgent

        public Place setRandomAgent(Agent agent)
        Sets a random Place as the agent's starting location.
        Parameters:
        agent - The agent to set.
        Returns:
        The Place in which the Agent was put at.

      • setRandomClients

        public void setRandomClients()
        This is to run periodically in the run of the world. Each time it runs it checks how many clients could be put in the world, it then creates a unique random id for the client and puts him randomly in a town where it has no agents (so that it won't be unfair to the other agents).
